intro: Erysimum gorbeanum, commonly known as the yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with linear to lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
